text: Indeed, SearchLight.jl is an ORM that implements the ActiveRecord design pattern and packs quite a few extra features (database migrations, environments, query generation, validators, serializers, etc). It's being used in the Genie community quite successfully. I can confirm that the lower level libraries it uses (MySQL.jl, SQLite.jl, and LibPq.jl) work great for standard CRUD operations and now that all are v1.x (if I'm not mistaken) they're stable. I have never ever used Python interop for DB access in Julia. :juliaheartpulsing:

text: Does SearchLight.jl support relationships like ActiveRecord?  I've used ActiveRecord as part of Ruby on Rails.  While ActiveRecord is not perfect for everything I found that it does provide a convenient interface for most things and allows one to get their hands dirty when desired/needed.  I looked at using SearchLight.jl for a small database I was making, but gave up after I couldn't find relationships (e.g. belongs_to, has_many, has_and_belongs_to_many, etc).  Maybe I didn't look hard enough?
